div2.p: Defines an anchor and may be used to establish a link to other document

Attribute specifies the role of the target elements of the event.

def.p: This attribute assigns one or more class names to an element; the element may be said to belong to these classes. A class name may be shared by several element instances.
This attribute specifies if the form should be deleted before navigate to it (only for WAP)

div2.head: The <carousel> element
div2.p: This element intends to display sequentially a catalogue of objects to be selected by the user. Moreover the content can be scrolled back and it can reference static images or the list items can be created dynamically

def.p: Indicates the type of object which will be the container of user's input (Map by default)

div2.p: This element is used to specify a control that represents a set of chained menus

def.p: This attribute defines meta-information about the element on which it is set

div2.head: The <definitions> element
div2.p: The definitions module for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <div> element
div2.p: The div element, in conjunction with the id, class and role attributes, offers a generic mechanism for adding extra structure to documents. This element defines no presentational idioms on the content. Thus, authors may use this element in conjunction with style sheets, etc

label.code: ( p* | a* | anchor* | secret* | input* | upload* | inputDate* | inputTime* | image* | figure* | reset* | label* | submit* | span* | trigger* | select* | select1* | table* | textarea* | menu* | chainedmenu* | list* | object* | telephonecaller* | phonebookadder* | smssend* | placard* | range* | output* | carousel* )

def.p: This attribute specifies that the element has an anchor in the document
This attribute defines meta-information about the element on which it is set

div2.head: The <ev:listener> element
div2.p: Element listener supports a subset of the DOM's EventListener interface. It is used to declare event listeners and register them with specific nodes in the DOM.
View definition of this element is on ev:listener

div2.head: The <eventsource> element
div2.p: The eventSource element, in conjunction with the id and src attributes, offers a generic mechanism to receive server-side events.

This attribute specifies the location of an external source for the contents of the element

div2.head: The <include> element
div2.p: The include element specifies the inlusion of divs into markup

def.p: The content to be included

This attribute may be included in any element in the document. Its value is a boolean expression. This expression may be evaluated by the server, client, or other adaptation layer: if it evaluates to 'true' then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its child and attribute nodes, are selected for inclusion in the output document. If the expression evaluates to false, then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its children, are omitted from the output document.

div2.p: The l element represents a semantic line of text (e.g., a line of verse or a line of computer code)

div2.head: The <link> element
div2.p: An element that can be used to define links to external resources. These resources are often used to augment the Language Processor's ability to process the associated document

def.p: This attribute may be included in any element in the document. Its value is a boolean expression. This expression may be evaluated by the server, client, or other adaptation layer: if it evaluates to 'true' then the element containing the display attribute, and all its child and attribute nodes, are displayed. If the expression evaluates to false, then the element containing the display attribute, and all its children, are not displayed.

This attribute may be included in any element in the document. Its value is a boolean expression. This expression may be evaluated by the server, client, or other adaptation layer: if it evaluates to 'true' then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its child and attribute nodes, are selected for inclusion in the output document. If the expression evaluates to false, then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its children, are omitted from the output document.
This attribute specifies a URI that is actuated when the element is activated
See http://www.w3.org/TR/2005/REC-xml-id-20050909/
This attribute describes the relationship between the resource specified by the about attribute (or its default value) and the resource referred to by the href attribute

div2.head: The <meta> element
div2.p: The meta element can be used to identify properties of a document (e.g., author, expiration date, a list of key words, etc.) and assign values to those properties.

def.p: This attribute specifies which resource has a specified property
This attribute specifies the metadata associated with an element. If not specified, then the metadata for an element is its content
This attribute defines the datatype of the content metadata of the element. If the attribute is not specified, then the default value is string as defined by [XMLSCHEMA]
This attribute indicates which property is being defined by the element. If it is not specified, the property is reference

div2.head: The <metadata> element
div2.p: Metainformation for IDEAL document

div2.head: The <object> element
div2.p: Object indicates a non-text item for inclusion in the document; this includes images and other media, as well as executable content which require plugins or external applications to process

def.p: Decorator should be shown nearer the element
This attribute specifies the location of an external source for the contents of the element
This attribute defines a text to display while the object is loading

element

div2.p: The param element defines a generic parameter in an IDEAL document

def.p: The name attribute indicates the name that will be used for this contact in the phone book
This attribute specifies the value that is sent as parameter on the request when the control is activated

div2.head: The <phonebookadder> element
div2.p: This element allows the user to add phone numbers directly to device's phone book from the browser

def.p: The name attribute indicates the name that will be used for this contact in the phone book
This attribute represents the telephone number. It must not have any spaces or other characters between the digits and it is recommended to precede it always with the country number

div2.head: The <placard> element
div2.p: This container presents elements like text, images, etc in a predefined layout

div2.p: This form control allows selection from a sequential range of values

Optional hint for the ending bound for the range
When true, this form control will generate additional xforms-value-changed events
Binding expression interpreted as a node on context
Optional hint for the lexical starting bound for the range
Optional value to use for incrementing or decrementing the value
Indicates the type of validation associated with a UI component

div2.head: The <repeat> element
div2.p: This element defines a UI mapping over a homogeneous collection selected by the nodeset attribute

div2.head: The <td> element
div2.p: At least one is mandatory within a table row (tr), they are mutually exclusive within the same row

def.p: This attribute assigns one or more class names to an element; the element may be said to belong to these classes. A class name may be shared by several element instances.

This attribute may be included in any element in the document. Its value is a boolean expression. This expression may be evaluated by the server, client, or other adaptation layer: if it evaluates to 'true' then the element containing the display attribute, and all its child and attribute nodes, are displayed. If the expression evaluates to false, then the element containing the display attribute, and all its children, are not displayed.

This attribute may be included in any element in the document. Its value is a boolean expression. This expression may be evaluated by the server, client, or other adaptation layer: if it evaluates to 'true' then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its child and attribute nodes, are selected for inclusion in the output document. If the expression evaluates to false, then the element containing the expr attribute, and all its children, are omitted from the output document.

div2.head: The <telephonecaller> element
div2.p: This element allows the user to make phone calls directly from device's browser

def.p: This attribute (Computer Telephony Integration) allows interactions between the phone and a computer, including pauses and user actions. This is usually useful for voice services, or to make a phone call through a phone switchboard
This attribute represents the telephone number. It must not have any spaces or other characters between the digits and it is recommended to precede it always with the country number
